name: Remy Russell
Summary: Understand the users, buyers, and the problems worth solving to ensure success of the business
Inspire cross-functional collaboration to align on the most promising strategies
Drive the execution of the vision through rapid iteration of discovery and delivery

professionalExperience.position: Associate Product Manager, Platform and Integrations teams
professionalExperience.description: Product Lead for a Case Management platform used by social service providers (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, and more)
highlights: Elicited insights to prioritize valuable initiatives, evolving the platform’s capabilities
Analyzed APIs and integration use cases to extend user calabilities and defined technical requirements for engineering teams
Managed stakeholder communication and owned relationships with external users and partners
Maintained the roadmap, defined KPIs and established mechanisms to measure them
achievements: Helped drive growth in ARR from 10M to 15M by expanding features, supporting/improving implementation processes, and increasing platform interoperability, ultimately leading to CaseWorthy's acquisition of Eccovia
Shipped a new RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded over 10 customer organizations to start using it for their custom integration use cases
Helped establish a Product Catalog and a platform-based, microservice approach to solving new problems in a way that enabled future growth/expansion

Led new growth initiatives and gained experience shipping and/or scrapping MVPs to integrate with third parties to extend user capabilities (e.g., Twilio for Email & SMS, Onfleet and WorkWave for last-mile delivery operations, Health Information Exchanges, Medicaid Payers, a Claims Processing System, a pharmacy benefit manager, external data warehouses, etc.)

highlights: Led problem discovery and requirements gathering with new customers during the initial design and implementation of their solution on the case management platform
Supported complex data migration efforts, custom integration solutions, and training/onboarding of new users
achievements: Successfully implemented new and complex solutions for two of Eccovia's top ten customers by ARR
Pushed the platform interoperability capabilities to the limits and drove the evolution of features to unlock the capabilities requested by our customers

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Worked with internal team and stakeholders from the Utah Department of Health on system migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a Medicaid Management Information System ...
highlights: Partnered with the State customer stakeholders to define and document comprehensive design details for the Provider Enrollment Subsystem (to guide development and testing)

professionalExperience.description: Learned the end-to-end functionality of CNSI’s 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution and re-authored technical documentation to comply with standards ...
highlights: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services to design and implement compliant functionality

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015
education.coursework: Relational database design, computer programming, process improvement, modeling, simulation, statistical analysis, decision analysis, lean management, business development, and more

coreSkills: Technical communication and cross-functional collaboration with engineers
Problem-solving and ownership of complex challenges
Ability to articulate technical details and high-level strategy
Quick learner of new tools, technologies, and methodologies
Proficiency in SQL and ability to read and understand most programming languages with time
HL7 fundamentals (v2.x and FHIR) with v2.x ADT and CDA integration experience
Experience with Revenue Cycle Management integrations for Medicaid eligibility checks and claim submission and remittance (X12 EDI Standards)
toolsAndFrameworks: Microsoft (Azure, Power Automate, PowerBI), Atlassian (Jira, Confluence), ProductBoard, Figma, Postman, Lucidchart
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, hiking, camping)

'Vibecoding' and otherwise playing with LLMs to help me solve problems
